column1: Once at sunset an old man came through the forest where the poplar trees lived. The trees were going to sleep
column2: and it was growing dark.The man held something under his cloak. It was a pot of gold—the very pot of gold that lies at the foot of the rainbow. He had stolen it and was looking for some place to hide it. A poplar tree stood by the path."This is the very place to hide my treasure
column3: the man said. The branches spread out straight
column4: and the leaves are large and thick. How lucky that the trees are all asleep!"He placed the pot of gold in the thick branches
column5: and then ran quickly away.The gold belonged to Iris
column6: the beautiful maiden who had a rainbow bridge to the earth. The next morning she missed her precious pot. It always lay at the foot of the rainbow
column7: but it was not there now.Iris hurried away to tell her father
column9: of her loss. He said that he would find the pot of gold for her.
